tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: We have been consulting Dr Deepthi Mahajan since 4 yrs for our daughter. We used to see her in motherhood Sarjapur Road before  where my daughter was born. Since  that day she is the only Pediatrician we are seeing till now. We visit for vaccinations and periodic viral infections that she suffers  from. Each time we see her she listens to the problem carefully and does right diagnosis of the condition and prescribes appropriate medicine. She starts with mild medication in the beginning and waits for the child to respond to it and then move on to antibiotics only if necessary. This is what we like most in her and also she doesn’t scare parents by advising to do lots of tests and reports. Overall she is ver reliable  and efficient doctor that one can look for.
reply_text: Thanks a lot for your valuable feedback !

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: We have visited  Dr Deepti couple of times in last 2 yrs for our child's illness and routine vaccination. Doctor is very nice and handles the issues very calmly. She is an expert in her field. She answers all our questions and understand our worries. We went for vaccination recently and had some concern over our child's weight gain issue. She clarified our doubts well. We were very  happy with the interaction.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: When my daughter was 5 months she got fever more than 10 days her temperature was 102 & 103. We have consulted 2 doctors but fever was still 103. Then we visited Sarjapur Motherhood, there doctor Deepti examined my baby and said to admit her in hospital. My baby had pneumonia. Doctor gave proper care on third day she came to normal. I am very grateful. Now she is 2 years 3 months she is very fine. We are consulting doctor for my two kids. Dr. Deepti is God in disguise. Because of doctor our daughter is with us .
reply_text: Your feedback is very touching and encouraging....it's a reward for a doctor..thank you!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: went to Deepthi Mahajan for my kid's 14 week vaaccine...Thought of discussing some things with her but she did not even listen to them and didn't comfort the baby before giving vaccine she had given injection and there is also one oral vaaccine my child is crying alot and even she didn't wait a second till he settles calm and given oral vaaccine directly from the medicine bottle...the other two vaccines given for my child they used to give from a injection like tube into his mouth but she given directly from the bottle when he is crying alot without breathing...there are the one who should have patience and they need to even check the baby growth and milestones...she didn't even bother about them directly given the injection and went to her seat..just she had done the task which I went but didn't think about child...never recommended her...she had no patience to listen to us..
reply_text:
Thanks for the  feedback!  Parents who come for vaccination normally know that it is temporary painful experience for baby and they do understand that it is actually for their baby's benefit in long run to protect against many serious infections. As doctors , we try to do best to out little patients. We try to explain about vaccines and possible side effects, how to deal with them and at same time ,see if baby is growing appropriate for age. We try to answer to your queries and clarify parents doubts. We are more than ready for that.. ...But people need to ask if something is bothering them. If you think about discussing something, then discuss. Ask.. Doctor can not read your mind. 
Also, oral vaccine which is provided by company in a vial has to be given that ways as it is sterile. 
Best wishes !

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I had consulted the doctor during my baby birth and later on video call as well. During those, I was happy with her. What really broke my experience was when i visited her at Sarjapur motherhood for vaccination and consulation of my month old baby.Couple of problems1. Doctor never explained to me what vaccines are being given. Nurse told me doctor would do and doctor never bothered to do before giving them. As a parent its my right to know what is being administered and its impact.I know its written in a booklet but you shoudl still explain.2. Doctor never took time to comfort the baby before doing vaccinations. I have another daughter who was vaccinated by 4 different doctors during her time, *** **** *** ** **** * ****** She came and just Did her job as if she was being forced to do it.3. I opted for a painless vaccination and the result is after a day i see start of infection on both her legs. I consulted another doctor who is of similar experience. * ***** **** *** **** *** ** **** ** ***** ****** *** **** *** ** **** ***** ** **** ********* This was not at all done with care.** *** ***** ******** ** **** ** ** **** ******** ** ******* ************ I risked taking my baby to hospital mainly for consulation and she didnt even care. All my questions are answered in 2 words " Its normal" . **** *** *** ***** ******* *** ********** ** ****** *** ***** ** ** **********I have already consulted some other doc and not going to come to her again. I hope things improve in future. I have no problema with Hospital though.
reply_text: Thanks for the feedback..! .Covid-19 pandemic being at its peak does not allow lengthy discussions in OPD.All your queries were answered precisely,to the point & u appeared satisfied at that time. Vaccine were discussed prior to giving. It is surprising & worrying  to see you having no respect for doctors who are doing their best in Covid pandemic ,even putting their own life at risk !!  Anyways.....Any vaccine(even "painless ") has potential to cause problems in the area they are  given. Vaccine side effects are universal & are not created by doctors. In such situations,we appreciate if the patient reverts back( visit/call/ msg) so that we can help. ...Lastly, my knowledge & experience gives me confidence to say-"Its normal". Many newborn issues like colic, reflux settle as baby grows with minimal medication ,which was discussed with you... Hope you get it.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Doctor doesn't take the question asked by parents, she even don't touch the baby and gets irritated if baby cries. I visited doctor Ali from same hospital previously and today I couldn't get his appointment so I visited doctor Deepthi and tried to tell about my previous visit,. She refused to listen even the history of the baby and said I don't care about the previous visit with other doctor. * **** **** ** **** **** ****** **** *** *** *** ****** ******* *** ***** *** *** **** *** *** * ***** **** ** *** ****** ***** ** ** ******* *** **** ****** *** **** **** ****** **** ** ****** ******** ********** ******** ***** ***** ***** ******* ***** **** ** ****** *** *** ******* *** ********** *****
reply_text:
Hello Mr Ankit !....There are strings of lies in your feedback.
1. Your baby was examined thoroughly.  20 yrs in pediatrics has given me enough experience to examine a crying baby. But I can recall your impatience & irritable behaviour!! Introspect ..!
2. Your questions were answered very clearly. People who visit me regularly for years  will be able to understand your lie. Their trust speaks volume about doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
We have been consulting Dr. Deepti Mahajan for over 2 years for my daughter. Either for vaccinations or consultation for fever, cold & cough or nutrition suggestions, she is very good & patient in explaining the cause of the issue & how she is planning to address it. Her suggestions on balanced diet helped my daughter overcome constipation problem. 
We even consulted her acne & skin rash.  With her suggested body & face cream, the acne came down in 2-3 days. 
Had a very good experience with Dr. Deepti Mahajan & I would highly recommend her.
reply_text: Thank you for your valuable feedback !!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
context: stomach and intestinal infections,Cough In Children,
review: Dr. Deepti is someone whom I was able to trust completely for my child. She is always one step ahead and if she thinks there could be a problem, she will never ignore rather proactively looks for it. She acts fast and has a great problem solving attitude and kind nature. She always understand and emphathise whenever we describe severity of a problem and doesn't make us feel like we are over reacting over anything. Thank you Dr. Deepti, you have always been amazing and I always feel we are in safe hands with you.
reply_text: Thank you very much for your valuable feedback and kind words...Appreciate it..!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
We have been consulting with Dr. Deepti Mahajan since October 2019 for my daughter (Avni) until as recently as August 2021. Dr. Deepti has a unique capability to keep her patients and their parents at ease in situations where kid is quite sick. She pays close attention on the concerns and then provides a step by step consultation which is easier to follow. She also engages well with kids which helped us in having hassle free vaccinations. From hereon we will have only "online consultation" available  with us as we are relocating out of India, but this is to all who are looking out for a great pediatrician on whom you can trust for nothing less than an excellent care. 

Thank you, Doctor - From Avni!
reply_text: Thank you for your kind words....!! Really appreciate.
